intro: Sickmannia radiata, commonly known as the radiate sickmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, creating a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Sickmannia radiata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
